document.docAuthor: Magalhães, Ivan L. F., Brescovit, Antonio D. & Santos, Adalberto J.
document.docTitle: Sicarius cariri Magalhães, Brescovit & Santos, 2013, new species
document.masterDocTitle: The six-eyed sand spiders of the genus Sicarius (Araneae: Haplogynae: Sicariidae) from the Brazilian Caatinga

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The six-eyed sand spiders of the genus Sicarius (Araneae: Haplogynae: Sicariidae) from the Brazilian Caatinga

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Sicarius tropicus : Lucas et al. 1981 : 132
,
Figs 1–2
(misidentification);
Pinto-da-Rocha 1995
: 71
(misidentification).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. This species is the most widespread in the Brazilian Caatinga. As
S. tropicus
was the only species known from Brazil , some authors erroneously assumed that the individuals they had examined belonged to that species. We have examined the specimens mentioned in the two studies cited above and are certain that they are
S. cariri
n. sp.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 72–79.
Sicarius cariri
n. sp.
female internal genitalia. 72. Paratype from São Raimundo Nonato, Piauí (IBSP 162356), dorsal. 73. Same, ventral. 74. Riacho Seco, Bahia (IBSP 161060), dorsal. 75. Same, ventral. 76. Guaribas, Piauí, Brasil (IBSP 56025), dorsal. 77. Same, ventral. 78. Bom Jesus, Piauí (MZSP 21551), dorsal. 79. Same, ventral. Scale bars: 100μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Male holotype from Desfiladeiro, Parque Nacional da Serra da Capivara (
8 ° 46 ' 0.3 ''S
42 ° 28 ' 39.9 ''W
, 508m ), São Raimundo Nonato, Piauí, Brazil ,
19 /II/ 2012
, I.L.F. Magalhães et al. coll. , deposited in IBSP 162345 . Paratypes : same collecting data, 13 ( IBSP 162345 ), 13 (CHNUFPI 259 ), 13 ( IBSP 162347 ), 13 ( IBSP 162348 ), 13 ( MNRJ 6522 ), 13 ( MPEG ARA- 19205 ), 13 ( IBSP 162351 ), 13 ( IBSP 162352 ), 1 Ƥ ( IBSP 162356 ), 1 Ƥ ( IBSP 162357 ), 1 Ƥ (CHNUFPI 260 ), 1 Ƥ ( MZSP 48988 ), 13 ( UFMG 11040 ), 13 ( UFMG 11041 ), 13 ( MZSP 48987 ), 1 Ƥ ( UFMG 11043 ), 1 Ƥ ( UFMG 11044 ), 1 Ƥ ( UFMG 11045 ); Parque Nacional da Serra da Capivara, Toca da Boca do Sapo (
8 ° 51 ' 0.5 ''S
42 ° 33 ' 55.2 ''W
, 446m ),
21 /II/ 2012
, I.L.F. Magalhães et al. coll. , 13 ( IBSP 162338 ), 13 ( IBSP 162339 ), 1 Ƥ ( MPEG ARA- 19206 ), 1 Ƥ ( IBSP 162342 ), 1 Ƥ ( IBSP 162343 ), 13 ( UFMG 11038 ), 1 Ƥ ( MNRJ 6523 ); (
8 ° 52 ' 46.6 ''S
42 ° 43 ' 14.8 ''W
, 535m ), 13 ( IBSP 162714 ), 13 ( IBSP 162714 ); (
8 ° 53 ' 10.1 ''S
42 ° 33 ' 19.5 ''W
, 368m ),
18 /II/ 2012
, I.L.F. Magalhães et al. coll. , 13 ( IBSP 162335 ), 1 Ƥ ( IBSP 162337 ), 13 ( UFMG 11037 ); [
8 ° 46 ' 0.3 ''S
42 ° 28 ' 39.9 ''W
, 318m ],
30 /VI/ 2001
, A.C. Aguiar coll. , 1 Ƥ ( DZUB 1226 ).
Etymology. The species name honors the Cariri people, a group of Native Americans whose territory is located in Northeastern Brazil . Cariri is a word meaning silent or sullen.

Diagnosis . Males of
S. cariri
n. sp.
are similar to those of
S. diadorim
n. sp.
in the embolus, which forms an almost right angle in relation to the rest of the bulb and has a curvature in apical view, with its concavity facing retrolaterally (
Fig. 66
), but differ in the shorter embolus (
Figs 64–71
, 127 ). Females differ from those of other species by having fewer branches in the spermathecae (typically 12 or less in
S. cariri
n. sp.
, 16 or more in other species), which are highly convoluted and usually long (
Figs 72–85
,
136– 137
,
144– 145
). This species has second femora of intermediate length between
S. tropicus
and
S. diadorim
n. sp.
(mean±SD of femur II/carapace length: males 1.51 ± 0.07 , females 1.16 ± 0.05 ; see Variation) (Fig. 47 ). Subadult females have few ( 8–10 ) incipient branches in the spermathecae, which are very similar in shape to those of adults (
Figs 86–87
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 80–87.
Sicarius cariri
n. sp.
female internal genitalia. 80. Santa Quintéria do Maranhão, Maranhão (IBSP 35472), dorsal. 81. Same, ventral. 82. Xique-Xique, Bahia (IBSP 162288), dorsal. 83. Same, ventral. 84. Itaguaçu da Bahia, Bahia (IBSP 28955), dorsal. 85. Same, ventral. 86. Subadult female from Santa Quintéria do Maranhão, Maranhão (IBSP 35746), ventral. 87. Subadult female from Bom Jesus, Piauí (IBSP 27793), dorsal. Scale bars: 100μm.

FIGURES 88–91.
Sicarius diadorim
n. sp.
males. 88. Holotype from Itacarambi, Minas Gerais (UFMG 10789), left palp, prolateral. 89. Same, bulb. 90. Palmas do Monte Alto, Bahia (IBSP 161080), left bulb, prolateral. 91. Itaobim, Minas Gerais (UFMG 10157), left bulb, prolateral. Scale bars: 100μm (except 88, 1000μm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description . Male ( IBSP 162345 , holotype ). Coloration and general appearance as described for the genus. Total length 12.25 . Carapace: length 5.93 , anterior width 2.44 , thoracic region width 6.34 . Clypeus height 0.97 . Eyes diameters and interdistances: ALE 0.25 , PLE 0.23 , PME 0.2 , ALE–PLE 0.25 , PME–ALE 0.66 . Sternum: length 2.43 , width 3.14 . Leg I: femur 8.17 , patella 2.75 , tibia 9.1 , metatarsus 7 , tarsus 3.34 . II: femur 9.4 , tibia 9.6 . III: femur 8.4 , tibia 8.1 .IV: femur 7.92 , patella 2.47 , tibia 7.75 , metatarsus 6.42 , tarsus 2.92 . Opisthosoma: length 5.83 , width 5.42 . Seven picks in the palpal femur. Palp as in
Figs 64–71
,
126– 127
.

Female ( IBSP 56025 , Guaribas, Piauí ). Coloration and general appearance as described for the genus. Total length 13.05 . Carapace: length 5.83 , anterior width 2.94 , thoracic region width 6.41 . Clypeus height 1.02 . Eyes diameters and interdistances: ALE 0.25 , PLE 0.23 , PME 0.2 , ALE–PLE 0.23 , PME–ALE 0.71 . Sternum: length 2.51 , width 3.12 . Leg I: femur 6.14 , patella 2.27 , tibia 6.68 , metatarsus 4.98 , tarsus 2.8 . II: femur 6.75 , tibia 6.58 . III: femur 6.25 , tibia 5.58 . IV: femur 6.2 , patella 2.04 , tibia 5.8 , metatarsus 4.84 , tarsus 2.52 . Opisthosoma: length 6.58 , width 6.08 . Six picks in the palpal femur. Spermathecae as in
Figs 72–85
,
136– 137
,
144– 145
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 92–103.
Sicarius diadorim
n. sp.
female internal genitalia. 92. Paratype from Itacarambi, Minas Gerais (UFMG 11605), dorsal. 93. Same, ventral. 94. Fazenda Trijunção, Cocos , Bahia (DZUB 5000), dorsal. 95. Same, ventral. 96. Female from the same locality (IBSP 42147), dorsal. 97. Same, ventral. 98. Espinosa , Minas Gerais (IBSP 162292), dorsal. 99. Same, ventral. 100. Guanambi, Bahia (AMNH), dorsal. 101. Same, ventral. 102. Subadult female from Itacarambi, Minas Gerais (UFMG 4880), dorsal. 103. Subadult female from the same locality (UFMG 4881), dorsal. Scale bars: 100μm.

FIGURES 104–109.
Sicarius ornatus
n. sp.
males. 104. Holotype from Milagres, Bahia (IBSP 161102), left palp, prolateral. 105. Same, bulb. 106. Itabaiana, Sergipe (IBSP 162807), left bulb, prolateral. 107. Male from the same locality, left bulb, prolateral. 108. Ituaçu, Bahia (IBSP 162249), left bulb, prolateral. 109. Andaraí, Bahia (MNRJ 6355), left bulb, prolateral. Scale bars: 100μm (except 102, 1000μm).
